|åæµ·é|HokkaidÅ|literally "Northern Sea Circuit"}}, formerly known as 'Ezo',
|'Yezo', 'Yeso', or 'Yesso', is Japan's second largest island; it is also the
|largest and northernmost of Japan's 47 prefectures. The Tsugaru Strait
|separates Hokkaido from Honshu, Nussbaum, Louis-
|FrÃ©dÃ©ric. (2005). "Hokkaido" in  although the two islands are connected
|by the underwater railway Seikan Tunnel. The largest city on Hokkaido is its
|capital, Sapporo, which is also its only ordinance-designated city.
